explanations.A: Addition is commutative which means the order doesn't matter. That means we can write this as b + c + c. We cannot combine different algebraic terms (such as b and c) when we are adding, but we can combine the two 'c' terms. c + c is the same as two lots of c which we can write as 2c. So c + b + c = b + 2c.
